sub_topic: Finding the perimeter of a rectangle.
message_1: A rectangular garden has a length of 20 meters and a width of 10 meters. What is the perimeter of the garden in meters?
message_2:
To find the perimeter of a rectangle, you can use the formula P = 2(L + W), where P is the perimeter, L is the length, and W is the width.

In this case, the length (L) is 20 meters and the width (W) is 10 meters. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

P = 2(20 + 10)
P = 2(30)
P = 60 meters

The perimeter of the garden is 60 meters.
